newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: TENNIS-CHANG OVERCOMES MEDVEDEV AT AUSTRALIAN OPEN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-CHANG OVERCOMES MEDVEDEV AT AUSTRALIAN OPEN.

text.p: American world number two Michael Chang powered into the quarter-finals of the Australian Open on Sunday after coming from a set behind to oust Ukraine's Andrei Medvedev.
The towering Medvedev has been playing some of the most exciting tennis of the Melbourne championships and an upset appeared on the cards after he took the first set 6-4.
But Chang, leaving nothing to chance, soon exerted his authority and closed Medvedev out of the match to win 4-6 6-2 6-2 6-1.

It was a virtuoso performance by Chang, who has not won a grand slam since capturing the French Open at 17 in 1989. The scoreline in the last three sets belied a solid performance by Medvedev, who was eventually beaten by Chang's refusal to let any shots past him.
Chang will next meet either Sweden's number seven seed Thomas Enqvist or Chilean Marcelo Rios, the number nine seed.
